answers.answer: Do you want to do it cold turkey? How long have you been abusing roxies? The more info you can supply the better advise we can give to help you.
So you are using 300 mg roxies/day? Are you taking them for pain or recreation?

Hi!  We can help you online here, but we don't usually meet in person.  If you're wanting to quit cold turkey, have you thought about speaking to a doctor first?  If you have any health issues, it would be unsafe to stop that much daily opiate without consulting a doctor.  You're on a strong narcotic, so when you stop your BP is going to go up quite a bit.  Also, if you have diabetes or stomach issues, it's not advisable to stop cold turkey. Same with any heart/lung problems.  WD is hard on the body.  You'll go without sleep for a while too!  It's just a good idea to speak to a doctor unless you're 100% healthy.  You're on a pretty decent dose, so I DEFINITELY recommend you speak to someone first.Do you have a family doctor?  Or access to an urgent care?  There are things you can buy OTC to help too.  Look at the health pages on the bottom right or top right of this page at the Thomas Recipe.  It's got good info.  You can also read the Amino Acid Protocol.  Also good info when quitting opiates.If you want to permanently quit using, you'll need to go to NA or therapy for aftercare.  WDs will be for nothing if you don't get yourself some support!Best of luck to you!! :)
